      • play

        public void play()
        Description copied from interface: AudioSource
        Method to start sound source to play.

        Whatever sound was paused by method AudioSource.pause() it is still start playing from begining because method play() uses two other methods: AudioSource.stop() and AudioSource.continuePlaying().

        Specified by:
        play in interface AudioSource
        See Also:
        AudioSource.pause(), AudioSource.stop(), AudioSource.continuePlaying()

      • delete

        Description copied from interface: AudioSource

        Specified by:
        delete in interface AudioSource
        See Also:
        AudioMaster, AudioMasterBuffered

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Description copied from interface: AudioSource
        pause

          void pause()

        Method to stop sound to play.

        By this method Auidio Source remember the moment before stop and it can be continued after using method AudioSource.continuePlaying().

        Specified by:
        pause in interface AudioSource
        See Also:
        AudioSource.stop(), AudioSource.continuePlaying(), AudioSource.play()

      • continuePlaying

        public void continuePlaying()
        Description copied from interface: AudioSource
        Method to start sound to play from moment it was paused using method AudioSource.pause().
        Specified by:
        continuePlaying in interface AudioSource

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: AudioSource
        stop

          void stop()

        Method to stop sound to play.
        Unlike AudioSource.pause() method stop() don't make Audio Source to remember moment the sound stopped playing. That's why use of method AudioSource.continuePlaying() make sound play from begining.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface AudioSource
        See Also:
        AudioSource.pause(), AudioSource.play(), AudioSource.continuePlaying()

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f speed)

        setVelocity

          void setVelocity(Vector3f speed)

        Represents 3 dimentional speed of sound and sets how fast the sound will change in all 3 directions.

        Specified by:
        setVelocity in interface AudioSource
        Parameters:
        speed - Vector3f - 3 dimentional speed value
        See Also:
        AudioSource.setPosition(Vector3f)

          void setLooping(Boolean loop)

        Specified by:

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Description copied from interface: AudioSource
        isPlaying

          Boolean isPlaying()

        Method that check AudioSource if it is playing at that moment.

        Specified by:
        isPlaying in interface AudioSource
        Returns:
        true if it is playing
        false if it is stopped
        See Also:
